ygData.subject: Just an question...
ygData.msgSnippet: Last night I made the mistake of following a group of Paladins (and my number one rogue -- who is, by the way the best dungeon asset I ve ever had) into SolA
ygData.messageBody:
Last night I made the mistake of following a group of Paladins (and my number one rogue -- who is, by the way the best dungeon asset I've ever had) into SolA to harvest Melatite. I arrived just in time to see at least 10 clockworks chasing them out of the zone into Solb.

Faction wrecked, they decided to kill Kobolds in a repair attempt. We made our way to the Pool room? and, by the way, I did notice one of those paintings Harmonic was talking about (please follow up on that Harm, it seems really interesting!). We spent at least 2 hours there and I finally dinged into 29 (yeah I know, what the hell was I doing in SolB?).

My question is this - midway through a battle, an LDC popped in the pool room and proceeded to kick all of our asses down to nearly nothing in seconds. Luckily we all zoned with less than a bubble of health between the lot of us. Is that supposed to happen? Does one always spawn there or was it just my typical luck?

Thanks!
Weiland
Lvl 29 Bard of E. Marr
<Disciples of Truth>

PS - Finally got my bluebicite bp last night, so now my guild can't accuse me of getting dressed in the dark anymore - hehe! I'm so glad to be rid of the bronze. Blue everything with an orange bp was....how shall I put it.....~shiver~.... Ugly!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
